landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff is a tenant at 123 Maple Street, Defendant is the landlord/owner/lessor, that Plaintiff entered a tenancy beginning Dec. 1, 2022, and pays monthly rent of $1,200 (¶¶1–3). These facts sufficiently plead a landlord‑tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific affirmative statements by Defendant (representation that stain was "totally fixed") and repeated omissions/failures (failure to timely or adequately repair the leak, failure to remediate mold, minimization/dismissal of complaints) (¶¶5–8, 12, 17). Those are acts/omissions by the landlord.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges recurrent water intrusion through the ceiling, persistent musty odor and probable mold, physical symptoms (headaches), ruined personal property (laptop), and that Plaintiff must limit use of the studio and relocate bed/personal effects—allegations that describe a substantial interference with quiet enjoyment (¶¶7–11, 13, 17–18).

causation.reasoning: Complaint links the ongoing interference (recurrent leaks, mold, odors, property damage, loss of use) to Defendant's representation and failure to repair/remediate after notice (Plaintiff notified Defendant; Defendant failed to repair) and pleads those failures as the proximate cause of the harms (¶¶5–9, 12–13, 17).

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges concrete damages: ruined laptop (~$900), loss of full use of the premises (claimed $1,200), physical discomfort/headaches, diminution of rental value, inconvenience/emotional distress, and estimates total damages of at least $2,100 (¶¶9, 11, 13–14, 19).
